description:
This indicator measures the average temperature for each year across different regions worldwide.

It provides insights into climate trends and helps identify warming or cooling patterns over time.

Data is aggregated from multiple sources to ensure reliability and coverage.

datasets.name: ERA5 Climate Reanalysis (1979â€“2023)
datasets.description:
The ERA5 dataset provides hourly estimates of atmospheric variables on a global scale. It is based on a comprehensive data assimilation system combining satellite and ground-based observations.

This dataset is essential for climate modeling and weather forecasting applications.

datasets.name: Global Historical Climatology Network
datasets.description:
The GHCN dataset consists of station-based temperature records aggregated to monthly and yearly averages. It spans more than a century, allowing long-term climate studies.

The dataset is frequently updated and quality-controlled by NOAA.

description:
This indicator monitors changes in global mean sea level using satellite altimetry and tide gauge data.

Rising sea levels pose significant risks to coastal communities, infrastructure, and ecosystems.

Tracking sea level change is critical for climate impact assessments and adaptation planning.

datasets.name: Satellite Altimetry Data
datasets.description:
Satellite altimetry provides precise measurements of sea surface height from space, with global coverage since 1993.

These measurements enable the detection of trends and variations in sea level at various temporal and spatial scales.

datasets.name: Tide Gauge Records
datasets.description:
Tide gauge data offers long-term sea level measurements from coastal stations worldwide. Although spatially limited, these records provide invaluable historical context.

They are used alongside satellite data to improve sea level change estimates.

description:
Analyzes the amount, frequency, and distribution of precipitation globally.

Understanding precipitation trends helps in managing water resources, agriculture, and disaster risk related to floods and droughts.

The indicator combines data from weather stations, radars, and satellites.

datasets.name: Global Precipitation Measurement (GPM)
datasets.description:
GPM provides high-resolution, near-real-time precipitation data from a constellation of satellites.

It covers a broad range of precipitation types including rain, snow, and hail.

This data is crucial for hydrological modeling and weather forecasting.

datasets.name: Climate Prediction Center Rainfall Data
datasets.description:
This dataset includes monthly precipitation analyses derived from multiple sources and is used extensively for climate monitoring.

It offers regional to global scale precipitation information essential for drought assessment.
